definitions: Pulls (someone or something) along forcefully, roughly, or with difficulty.
Causes (someone) to go somewhere they do not want to go.
Continues for a longer time than necessary or desirable.
Uses the drag-and-drop function on a computer.
examples: He drags the heavy box across the floor.
She always drags her friends to parties.
The meeting drags on for hours.
The car drags up the hill.
He drags the file to the trash icon.
